**Setup:** Velocity clone; dual twisted 24awg Ni/28awg kanthal @ .27Î©; cotton wicks; 45 W

**Testing:** FA 7 Leaves Ultimate @ 3%; Aged: 3 weeks

**Flavor description:** After about a week, this flavor is kind of a very mellow, dry, dusty leaf tobacco with hints of sweet licorice like spice.  After 3 weeks, the spice really comes out and turns a bit thicker, almost like a hint of real molasses.  This flavor has kind of an overall woodsy taste, but isn't "woody".  Kind of like walking through a forest during a drought.

**Off-flavors:** Reports of alcohol or perfume at higher percentages.  Personally, I get nothing "off" here @3% unless you were expecting "7 leaves" to be a green plant with 7 leaves :)

**Throat hit:** 6/10, dry, but still mellow

**Uses:** Decent shake and vape by itself at a lower percentage if you enjoy a bag of Bali Shag rolling tobacco or something like Drum or Top in a can with a subtle sweetness.  Also good as part of a cig tobacco base.

**Pairings:**  Other tobaccos, nuts, AP, maybe a touch of your favorite fruit or cream if you prefer.

**Notes:**   This definitely works well as a shake n vape if you're after something resembling rolling tobacco.  It is very light and mellow, but steeps into something slightly thicker, remaining fairly mellow.
